conclusion: First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W
Work done W = P(VC - VB) for constant pressure process
State A to B is isovolumetric with VA = VB = 2 x 10^-3 m^3
Pressure changes from 3 x 10^5 Pa to 2 x 10^5 Pa from A to B
No work is done from A to B since volume is constant
Temperature at B is 200 K using ideal gas law
State B to C is isobaric with PB = PC = 2 x 10^5 Pa
Volume changes from 2 x 10^-3 m^3 to 3 x 10^-3 m^3 from B to C
Work done from B to C is 200 J
Temperature at C is 300 K using ideal gas law
ΔU = 0 since temperature returns to initial value
Heat transferred Q = 200 J using first law of thermodynamics
Final answer: Heat transferred is 200 J
